/* Rivalries */ found this cite for the USC article, seems useful for both sides of the "greatest intersectional rivalry" :-)
I added one line of persuasive argument as to why notre dame is the most storied program in college football.

Added reference for citation about #2 stadium ranking by Sporting News
/* Distinctions */ this stat will change yearly, so "as of 2006" added for clarification
changed opening Heisman sentence, so it doesn't imply no one else has as many Heismans
/* Weis Era (2005–) */ Clarification upon the 2006 season
/* Weis Era (2005–) */ Criticism is way too vague & not referenced. Some critics: ND haters. Some who might not: ND fans that know the program is better off now than 2 years ago. It's all relative.
/* Media */ grammar correction and added reference

BC not a major rival. only played a handful of games compared to the other schools .Listed rivals are the same ones listed in rivalries section. ND students do not consider them a rival.
/* Heisman Trophy */ sentence implied OSU had seven winners. Only six winners, but 7 trophies.
This article is not a bio for Lou Holtz. That info is included in the Lou holtz article. This is only about Holtz at ND. Speculation is not appropriate for an encyclopedia article without references.
Boston College not a regular rivalry. Certainly not to warrant inclusion ahead of USC. Teams do not regularly play and will not in the future due to Big East obligations.
/* Heisman Trophy */ added runners up for Heisman
Undo revision 101230020 by [[Special:Contributions/LightningOffense|LightningOffense]] ([[User talk:LightningOffense|talk]]) Again, Eras are about caoching records, not detailed history.

Undo revision 101149682 by [[Special:Contributions/LightningOffense|LightningOffense]] ([[User talk:LightningOffense|talk]]) Eras are brief recaps of coaching records, not a detailed history.
Undo revision 101134204 by [[Special:Contributions/66.244.123.100|66.244.123.100]] ([[User talk:66.244.123.100|talk]]) It's about what happened duing this era.
deleted repeated word, changed sentence to make it sound less opinionated
Additional information regarding Holtz after Notre Dame is more appropriate for the Lou Holtz article. Any off field info is more apprpriate for an article about the History of Notre Dame football.
This article is about the on feild accomplishments of and losses regarding Notre Dame football. Deleted information is more appropriate for an in-depth article on the HISTORY of Notre Dame football.
This article is about the on feild accomplishments of and losses regarding Notre Dame football. Deleted information is more appropriate for an in-depth article on the HISTORY of Notre Dame football.
/* Davie/Willingham Era (1997–2004) */ Made a distinction that this was their 3rd overall and not 3rd under this era. I still believe adding 3rd is needed, but I can understand your point.
other violations not pertinent to era indicated. this is an argument over semantics.
Undo revision 100946445 by Tedmoseby. Stating the number of times is relevant, if not remove # of championships won. People can look that up on their own.
other violations is vague and immaterial to the era at hand. users can look up violations of any university if they so wish.
/* Davie/Willingham Era (1997–2004) */ ND was found guilty in 2 previous "major violations" cases. While not put on probation, they were "publicly reprimanded" by the NCAA. It's in the NCAA database
/* Davie/Willingham Era (1997–2004) */ - Dunbar not affiliated with Notre Dame in an official capacity. removed article details, links available. Article not about detailed history of ND football
Fix of references including, eliminating bare http links
Delete fansite links in accordance with [WP:NOT#REPOSITORY]]
/* Davie/Willingham Era (1997–2004) */ two other "major violations" were misconstrued & not relevant to the era they were placed in. Infractions were not similar and ND was not punished.
Changed from completes to competes. Completes is the wrong word choice in this instance and alters the sentence to make no sense.
/* Davie/Willingham Era (1997–2004) */ reinserted accurate and verified history that was deleted earlier
/* After Leahy (1954–1963) */ spelling correction: refferd to reffered
/* Notre Dame All-Time Coaching Records */ - removed Notre Dame from all time coaching records. ND is implied by the article
/* Distinctions */ - included boston globe link on graduation rates
Added information on football facilities, including a game day picture for ND stadium from my own collection.
redirected to All time records section
brief info of the rivals was added for those who do not want to redirect. Also, rivalries page does not meet wiki standards.
additional links to sites frequented by Notre Dame students, fans and alumni
included stat on oklahoma streak to create cynergy with article on the main notre dame page.
/* Distinctions */ - added stats on academics, from ND media guide. 42 is changed to 43 with recent additon of John Carlson to academic all-american honors. The stats for the grad rates can be found

Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/71.202.176.26|71.202.176.26]] to last version by Just H
/* Weis era (2005–) */ To call LSU white trash over a football game is pathetic, juvenile, and frankly, people who would write such remarks should be shot due to their stupidity. RIDICULOUS.
/* University of Notre Dame head football coaches */
/* Bowl games */ My MOTIVATION is that it is a fact and very relevant to the article. We don't just put good stuff about the team here.
/* Bowl games */ I think the question is, what's YOUR motivation for adding this? Can you justify besides "it's fact?" WHY is it relevant? Plus, are you going to site your addition?
/* Bowl games */ This is relevant information. It is a fact and should be in the article. Should we not put when they loss in the article so we don't hurt their feelings?
No, I agree, this is not needed in the article. This is more making fun of the team than useful information.
Come now, Kelley... let's not have ND homerism affecting decisions on what's appropriate content. There was nothing inappropriate or non-factual about what you removed. You just didn't like it.
rv: There is no NCAA record for average margin of defeat
